page.title: 06FARMING AND THE E.E.C.
page.content: THE FARM MANAGER AT{NAFFERTON}TOLD ME HOW THE {EEC MILK QUOTA SYSTEM}HAD AFFECTED HIS FARM.IN{1984}HE HAD TO REDUCE MILK PRODUCTION BY{9%}BASED ON THE PREVIOUS YEARS FIGURES.THE CUTBACK IN 1985 WAS A FURTHER 1%.IN ECONOMIC TERMS THIS REPRESENTS A DROP IN INCOME FROM {Â£144,000 TO Â£122,000}BECAUSE MILK PRODUCTION IS BELOW QUOTA OVER THE WHOLE OF BRITAIN HE IS ALLOWED TO INCREASE HIS HERD SLIGHTLY,BUT WILL NEVER REGAIN PRE 1984 LEVELS. {FUTURE TRENDS }THE MANAGER SEES 10% OF PRESENT FARM LAND BEING TAKEN OUT OF USE,MAINLY FROM SMALL LESS EFFICIENT FARMS.MANY PEOPLE WILL BE FORCED OUT OF AGRICULTURE,WITH INCREASING UN_ EMPLOYMENT IN RURAL AREAS.ONLY THE MOST INTENSIVE UNITS WILL SURVIVE,AND THESE WILL HAVE TO BECOME MORE EFFICIENT AND MECHANISED.
